Reviews.Title: I could slap Samsung on the front of this & you couldn't tell the difference
Reviews.Author: nikecmh
Reviews.Content: Hit the lottery unlike the negative reviewers here who lost said lottery and rate Amazon and not the product. Got the TV delivered 20 min ago. Here's my short but VERIFIED review:1. TV has 0 branding on the front. I could slap a Samsung sticker on it if I wanted to.2. The TV actually has the power outlet pointed downwards which I wondered why my last 5 TV's decided to still have it pointing out the back.3. The remote looks bad but works. Who cares.4. The sound isn't that bad like everyone complains about. No vibration like someone else said. Plus, anyone who buys a 40"+ tv and plans on using built in sound vs a home theater is crazy. Unless it's a tv that is going in a play room.5. Picture looks fine to me.6. The stand seems sturdy, the screws that go into it though strip easy so be careful =)7. HDMI inputs are on the side of the tv and are tight. Meaning, a normal HDMI head fits flush up against the tv. So if you have a cable with the big black ferrite connector close to the top, it's going to be tight.8. The TV's interface menu is quick and is laid out well if that matters.For my first off brand tv, this was a steal and I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Bought as a secondary TV, but was surprised to decide.....
Reviews.Author: hangman
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV with the thought that I would make it my secondary TV.  I have a 42" Panasonic Plasma (4 years old) in the living room, still so much better of a picture than most of the LCD's.  So I was surprised when I turned it on expecting lots of motion blur because of it's 60Hz refresh and watching NFL it was not an issue, then watching some basketball again no problems, then golf again no problems.  So I switched to other non sports programs again good picture.  Keep in mind I still feel that the picture quality and colors are better on my plasma but it was far better than expected.  Being that my plasma is in a room with 7 windows it gets lots of glare so for the time being I've decided to move the plasma to a secondary room and make this 50" my main TV.I have a nice surround sound set up so I never bothered turning on the TV to listen.  I would probably say it sucks but that's just because I've yet to hear a thin TV have good sound.  Thus I have surround sound.The only complaint I have is that the bolts on the back for wall mounting appear to be insufficient, but it will hold fine I just would have liked to see something a little bigger.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the price.
Reviews.Author: Aaron W. Sinn "Mr. Sinn"
Reviews.Content: I must say that I am impressed with this TV.  I love the fact that it doesn't have a logo on the front, it's just nice and sleek looking.  Also, like some other reviewers have stated, the picture quality is superb.  I haven't noticed any motion blur whatsoever, be it an action movie, comedy, cartoon, etc.  I for one, think that the sound quality of its built in speakers is quite laudable.  Better than my old LCD, by all means!  And, I must again agree with some other reviewers on here in stating this: if you don't like it's audio, you should probably have (or acquire)some decent home theater speakers anyways.  With the money you can save on this unit, why not splurge a little for decent audio?All in all: I would absolutely recommend this TV.  I love the way it looks, the picture quality, the sound, and most of all... the price point!  I was most impressed.

I'm happy with mines and hope it last for quite awhile if not square trade was only $40 for 3 years of warranty.I really hope this review helps,

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV.  Ignore the negative reviews!
Reviews.Author: CharlieG
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is a bargain for $500. As an AMAZON gold box deal at $288, it's a steal!  Please notice that of this date, not a single negative review has "Amazon verified purchase" below the title.After installing this HDTV (which has no brand markings on the actual HDTV),I did a side by side comparison with my Samsung 1080P/120Hz HDTV.  After a few adjustments in the easy to navigate windows, the picture on this HDTV looked almost identical to the Samsung. In full 1080P mode, the picture quality was excellent. You will not be disappointed.Sure the best way to listen to a HDTV is through a good sound system, but the speakers in this TV are fine.  No rattles, no muddy sound, just the sound you would expect from a flat screen HDTV (remember there is not much space to mount speakers in a FLAT screen HDTV so don't expect booming bass).This HDTV is easy to set up and connect to cable, DVD, a computer, or other sources.  It has three HDMI ports so connecting multiple source devices is a breeze.  This HDTV does not have an optical connection for sound, but it does have a digital coax output that works fine.  It will easily scan through the cable channels to find all unscrambled analog and HD channels and it finds them all the first time.  It takes several scans for the SAMSUNG to find all the channels.  The FCC requires cable companies to carry the unscrambled HDTV transmissions of all local stations.  The FCC doesn't prevent the cable companies from putting the HD channels in weird locations and moving them around and Charter cable does this frequently. The ability to do a fast auto scan for channels is very helpful.Here is another really amazing aspect of this HDTV. My Samsung remote control also works with this HDTV for most functions such as power, volume control, source/input and the up/down channel functions.The remote control supplied with this HDTV is fine.  It is not cheap and flimsy as the negative reviews have described it.  It doesn't have lighted buttons and the solid feel of expensive remotes, but it works well and is no different then the remotes supplied by many "brand name" HDTVs.Bottom line, this HDTV is a bargain at around $500. If you were lucky enough to snag the AMAZON gold box deal, congratulations!Update: (One Year later)  This TV is still working perfectly.  It has become my main TV and it performs flawlessly. The Hiteker remote has one minor issue.  When changing inputs with the remote, it sometimes takes several button presses to change inputs.  New batteries don't solve the problem.  All other remote functions work flawlessly.  The remote from my Samsung HDTV changes the input on the Hiteker so I know it's the remote supplied with the Hiteker. This is not a major issue, just a minor bug in the remote. A great TV and after a year, I am still very satisfied.  I'll update this review in another year.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, but Defective
Reviews.Author: JP Willingham
Reviews.Content: For $288 this is most definitely worth the money. This TV has great picture and the sound is not nearly as bad as I thought it would be. The sound is similar to that of name brand TV's audio, which still doesn't say much.However, the set I received had a quiet buzz or hum when it was on, it had one dead pixel in the top left, and had a dark band going across the middle of the screen that was about 2 inches thick. The first two complaints were not a big enough deal for me to return it, but the dark band running across the screen was noticeable on every color background except black. It was noticeable during videos and you could even see it on the "No Signal" screen, so it was not the source's problem.I will be getting a replacement set soon, and I will update the review based upon the new set I receive. If the new set still hums and has a dead pixel but no banding, I would give it 4 maybe 5 stars, because for the price it is well worth it. $400-$500 seems like a fair price for this TV especially if it is your first LCD.UPDATE:I got the replacement extremely fast, as in UPS picked up the old one and the next day I had the new one. Same buzz, still a single dead pixel, and the banding is still there. The band is now on the lower half of the screen as opposed to the upper half/middle. This band is a little less noticeable and I don't feel like going through the hassle of returning it.Regardless, I'm still happy with my purchase as it has a great picture and a great price.

Reviews.Content: it's cheap and of good quality. It connect to my xbox, pc and tvpad perfectly. Given its price and 1080p I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: Great bargain TV
Reviews.Author: Just a Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get this on Amazon's Thanksgiving day sale (yes, they do have TVs to ship, it's not a scam).  Set it up in the basement so I could get the Wii out of my living room, and hooked up the old Blu-Ray.  There is only one old-fashioned AV hookup, so if you have a Wii and a VCR, you will need an A/V switch box or some other solution.So far, it's been great.  The remote is simple (I consider this a plus), the connections are great for a wall mounting, and the sound is OK for a flat panel.  The picture doesn't seem as sharp as my other HDTV, but it isn't bad, either.  (I haven't tried playing with the settings yet.)The Wii looks OK, but the VCR looks terribly blocky.  Not the fault of the TV, of course, just a note.The box it came in was in good shape, but it's not a heavy-duty box at all, and only about 5 inches deep, so there is a risk of damage there.  It had the normal 4 blocks of foam at the corners, and a loose piece of 1" foam in front of the screen itself.  Not much protection for such a big-ticket item.  (My old 55-inch TV came in a huge, thick cardboard crate that was about 18 inches deep.)  But this one was easy for two people to carry, and I had no trouble hefting it up onto the TV stand by myself once it was out of the box.Even at the current price, it is a pretty good deal.  I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Competes with the Big Boy name Brands
Reviews.Author: M. Loveless
Reviews.Content: I got this TV during the 2012 Black Friday sale for $280, it was one of the best deals I ever got. I have waited a while to write the review because I wanted to see how the TV would hold up. We have used this TV in our living room as our main TV since Dec of 2012 and so far it has been excellent. The picture is sharp on HD channels, We watched the Life of Pi HD Blue Ray not too long ago and it was breath taking on this TV. Colors are rich and bright. Sound is great. I know the sound bar on our TV can go up to like 60 and we usually have it around 19-23 and thats with 4 cats, a parrot, and a 11 year old boy running around the house and you can still hear it just fine and clear when sitting at normal distance from the TV. Watching non-hd channels isnt too bad. When you first switch to a non HD channel you can definitely tell a difference, but after you watch it for a bit its like watching a normal tube TV and you dont notice anymore.We also noticed the TV was set on 780p and we had to manually go in to our cable settings and set it to 1080p. So some of you who arent getting an amazing picture might want to check your cable settings to make sure its on 1080p.As someone else said it has no branding on it, so when all my friends come over they always ask me who made the TV and comment on how nice it is. My one friend who is a major name brand buyer "has to have all the top of the line name brand items" is extremely jealous of how nice this tv is and what I paid for it.I had no issues with shipping. It was shipped fast, delivery company called twice to confirm delivery. The delivery guy who came was extremely nice, knowledgeable and helpful. He helped set the tv up exactly where we wanted it and everything.We have use the HDMI port without any problems and attached our laptop to the tv and used it as a monitor without issues, and its pretty awesome as a monitor! The HDMI slot was fine and not too close to other slots, we dont have the issue of it scraping the case when we insert the HDMI cable on it.The only downside I had was the remote kinda sucked, but we had a universal remote from comcast so we didnt need the remote that came with it anyway.All in all if they go on sale again this Black Friday 2013 for $280 or less Im going to buy another one if I can. Heck Ill buy 2 more if I can. One for the bedroom and one for my son!

Reviews.Title: VERY NICE
Reviews.Author: M. B.
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and the sound is excellent. The only negative is it does not have a source button to change the picture size. You have to go into the menu video to change it. Thats ok with me because I put it on the movie size and leave it. I will say that the HD is absolutely beautiful and second to none. I just installed it on 11-28-12 and I will update if problems happen in the future.Also, my delivery from Amazon did include removing it from the box and installing the base. I couldn't have been happier with the delivery and the notifing process.I had a terrible experience with Target on line delivery and I was so pleased with Amazon's excellent service. If you order on line from other companies DO NOT EXPECT much service from them-AMAZON IS THE BEST!!!!

Reviews.Title: At $396, Good Value
Reviews.Author: John Mooney
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace the last non HDTV in my home, and I'm very pleased with the TV. It's exactly as claimed, but not better.  If you're upgrading from a 5 year old or older TV, you will think this is the greatest purchase ever.  It's an attractive TV with a good picture and contrary to other reviews--the audio is just what you would expect from any flat screen TV without surround sound:OK, but not great.  That's the standard.Set up is easy and intuitive. The remote is kind of flimsy, but I use Cable TV so that's a non issue. Also, important, if you're looking for the Code to set this  up with your Cable...is the code for "Curtis Mathes"...so I assume the old Curtes Mathes changed its name to create this off-brand.Buy this if you get a great deal, but understand it is NOT the brilliant super HD of an LED...it's not even near  as great a picture as I get with my 60 inch Mitsubishi  DLP HDTV (which others have criticized and I LOVE).This Hiteker is fantastic as a 2nd TV in my Bedroom. Perfect really at the great price I got it for.If you want a primary TV, spend $100 to $200 more and get a better one.At $400 I love it...at $600 I would hate it.

Reviews.Title: A Worthwhile Gamble
Reviews.Author: Scott Underwood
Reviews.Content: I bought this in a sale for a significant discount, so I was a little worried that it would be a sub-standard product.  But so far it has been really great; the sound is sub-par, but that's true for most built-in sound systems, and what do you expect from a cheap TV? If they're going to cut costs somewhere that's the best place.  The picture was fine out of the box, and tweaking it was pretty easy.  I love the three HDMI ports, and all the ports are easy to reach and seem solidly built.  My only complaints are minor: the internal clock can be a bit screwy (it defaults to 2001 when left on auto-- long before the TV was even built!), and the remote is boring and ugly (no complaints about functionality though).  If you can get this TV for less than the name brands, it's probably worth your while.

Reviews.Title: Returning it in less than 7 days
Reviews.Author: Story "Story always has a story"
Reviews.Content: Decided to try not being a label "wh.re" and go with a inexpensive tv wirh dwcent reviews.  Have no idea what those people were thinking.  I moved a smaller RCA LED TV to put this bigger tv in family rm, and immediately saw the difference.  This tv has blurry edges, picture is no where near as crisp as my RCA. Also had a Sony Plasma and it had a better pic as well.  Sound sucks. Put it on the highest volume and still could barely hear it over my space heater.The remote looks cheap and has minimal functions, tried adjusting the color balance and could barely adjust it. But I decided what the heck, for the price and size I'll keep it... then while we're watching it (haven't had it a full week!) The sound goes out!!!! I double checked that it wasn't the cable box, changed channels, turned it off and on. NOPE, no sound. I turned the TV off, then back on... sound returned! And so will this no name tv.. be returned! Why would I want a replacement? I'm not wasting my time taking rhe risk of having to return another TV.

Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Title: HITEKER 50" TV
Reviews.Author: Marci Grohnke
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome!! My total was $488.00. Which includes the $25.00 mount. Granite, It took a week to get it, and when it came, it was completely cracked and looked like a big ink spot with multi-colored cracks in the middle. Amazon paid for the shipping, they sent it FEDEX Ground. Said the soonest they could get out me a replacement would be another week through FEDEX Ground once again. My hopes were not high, as the packaging in the box was not great and it looked like it was just thrown around. I had to repack the damaged TV, and ship it back. I even offered to pay for overnight, or even 2 or 3 day shipping myself, but all he kept saying was sorry, we can't do anything about it. Here's the thing, I had a huge party planned and and had to cancel. We ended up having it at another friends place so all worked out OK. They were true to their word and the replacement came exactly one week later. This time, I took it out of the box, found the cord and plugged it in with out putting the stand on it. The stand is not the strongest and a bit wobbly. Getting it mounted on the wall next week. Overall, the picture is excellent. The sound is alright, but I would recommend getting surround or a bar speaker if you are into movies, it's fine for regular TV but I will get an additional sound system for it eventually. I would totally recommend this TV. It doesn't have a name brand anywhere on the TV except when you turn it on, it's in HUGE letters, HITEKER. Who cares, the picture is crystal clear and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: ERIC
Reviews.Content: Just a great big TV at an amazing price. Short of high end features, but very short of high end price.

Reviews.Title: barebones 50" LCD works good.
Reviews.Author: Bob Loftus
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV. Not all of the features of much more expensive brands... but if you're not looking for the smart features like wifi and stuff, this is a great hidef 50" LCD.

Reviews.Title: Lightening deal buyer
Reviews.Author: Roger Fall
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. Absolutely no problems.Sound could be better but you can always buy $50 sound bar.Great deal from Amazon

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: pamb
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for under $300 as a Black Friday deal and am very pleased with it. Color looks very good using the vivid setting. The base is a little wobbly given the size of the TV. I would not put this TV within reach of small children without some type of additional mounting (probably the case for any flat screen TV this size).

Reviews.Title: Great tv, especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: AdiLady
Reviews.Content: We got this on awesome black friday special.  We have a sound bar so I really can't comment on the sound that the tv puts out b/c we have it set up with our sound bar.  However, we are very happy with the quality of the picture.  We have only had it for a couple weeks, but so far, I have zero complaints!

Reviews.Title: Awesome purchase
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd flat panel. I had a 32" westinghouse that I paid $800 for that went bad. I have a 40" Toshiba that I love. Then I got this on a Black Friday Lightning Deal for $288. after 2 weeks I am very happy with this set. One review said it was blurry during football so my first stop was nfl network. I didn't see anything diferent than my Toshiba shows. I am very happy with my purchase and would buy another.

Reviews.Title: Awesome BIG TV!
Reviews.Author: A. Mota
Reviews.Content: I was lucky and got this TV for $288 and I was very hesitant about this TV because I have never heard of the brand before and it was super cheap! But I am so glad I was able to get this TV, especially for the price I paid! It's awesome! It doesn't feel cheap like others have said, its pretty heavy, the stand doesn't feel like a cheap piece of plastic. We had it on the stand for a few days but now it's on a wall mount and it looks beautiful. The sound isn't bad but we did get a sound bar for whenever we want to watch movies, but that's the case for a lot of TV's like this. The picture is beautiful, great quality! I have absolutely no complaints!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Bought this on a black Friday special including regular shipping charges.  When It came, the delivery service installed it and  made sure everything was working right before they left.  I have been using it and it has a very fine picture and it works great.  Thanks Amazon for such a great product and service.

Reviews.Title: It's a bargain.
Reviews.Author: ducttapeandzipties
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a computer monitor so I wasn't concerned with super high quality video or a whole lot of features.  For the price this tv can't be beat.  I wish the remote was a little stronger, you have to actually point it at the tv for it to work.  I am very happy with it, I would buy another or recommend this to a friend.  I'm keeping my eyes on Hiteker in the future, I expect they will be coming out with more great stuff at unbelievable prices.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Shady
Reviews.Content: So, I have been in possession of this set for about two weeks now and despite my pre-delivery apprehensions of this unknown (to me) brand name 50" HD TV, I am really very happy with what I received. For the Black Friday (actually Thurs) lightening deal price of $288, I certainly did not go wrong and I'm even of the mind to say that I would likely have been as pleased if I had purchased this set under the current price, albeit much lighter in the wallet.This set is what it is said to be and does what it is suppose to do beyond my expectations. The picture quality is very clear and the colors, rich. And while it only has a 60Hz refresh rate, I am not finding any issues whatsoever with the fast images on the golf and football games that I have watched (except that the Lions lost yet again : (The sound quality does not have the depth that I'd prefer from it's rear-facing speakers (a common complaint w/ thin flat screens), but with a bit of adjusting under the audio settings, it is very comfortable to listen to and therefore not a big issue at all for me. I'm betting that an external speaker would make a noticeable difference but doubt that I will even bother.  I have absolutely no issue with the set's volume, either, finding it plenty loud enough even at less than the 25% level (w/great range to spare when the grandkids are over ;).The settings menu for picture, sound, channel, parental control, setup and 'others' is very easy to access and use.My biggest issue with this set (which won't be for cable users) is that I cannot, for some reason, pick up the local PBS channel (actually 3) via our roof-top antenna despite multiple channel scannings. I get it clearly on two other sets that are similarly connected, so the problem seems to be with this TV. I don't understand that lacking and cannot figure a way/setting to enable this specific reception. Frustrating.A very minor bother (almost not worth mentioning) is the set's clock. I cannot find a way to change it from military time to 12-hour. Obviously not a big deal, but it would be nice to have the option.The aesthetic quality of the set is quite nice, the narrow glossy frame (sans branding), the stand (sturdy and secure), etc, are basic in black so not worth expanding on. The variety of ports, as detailed in a previous reviewer's post, will more than cover my needs. They are located on the back/left and are side facing for easy access. The set's manual controls are located on the right side, convenient for walk-by shut-offs or volume changes, as I have it positioned.As for the remote control, while not the most attractive in design, I find it solid enough in the hand and user friendly.  From early searching, it seems that a replacement/spare controller may not be available and that a useable code for a programmable/universal remote might prove difficult/impossible to find. (although one reviewer suggested that a 'Curtis Mathis' code might work *shrug*). Should anyone find such a controller with a working code please share.Just to add, delivery of this item was Amazon at their best. Under their white-glove treatment, it was was shipped and delivered by CEVA, brought in the house, unboxed, assembled and set up, with the packaging gathered up and trucked off after our inspection and satisfaction that all was well.  This was my first time ordering such a large item online and much to my pleasure, Amazon's care made it painless!I recommend this TV set, even at today's price. The quality, price (lightning deal for me), and delivery exceeded my expectations all around!

Reviews.Title: worth every bit of the 288$
Reviews.Author: scandlous d
Reviews.Content: This is a first impression as I have only had the unit a few hours , but its well worth the 288.$ price tag I was lucky enough to get. The picture is bright and clean , although there is some break up around fast motion. This is to be expected with a 60mhz versus 120 or better. I did not have any of the sound quality issues as some have. The plastic bezel is really wide and cheap looking but its not noticeable when its on.This tv is a good deal at 500$...but at 288$ it was a steal. Now lets see how long it lasts.  ****UPDATE****I have put this unit through several hours of use now and I must say I am pleased with its performance. It looks and sounds great. The remote that comes with it is cheap looking but functional.It is nice that there are no brand badges on the unit to give away the maker and price. It looks like a more expensive tv than it is even at retail price.

Reviews.Title: Waited to see the outcome of the haters vs the lucky ones
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: I watched the gold box timer like most of you and when it reached zero i rapidly clicked on it, saw the price and went straight to check out. I look at it like this, if you was one of those people who needed to see specs first, you missed out on a 50 inch TV for 288 dollars. I don't care what brand it is, for that price and yes Walmart customers have given this TV decent reviews for twice the amount. This won't be my family TV, perfect for a game room.. Man cave.My TV gets here on Friday and I will update.You can always clear it out of in box if you didn't want it. Just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Objective Revew by ACTUAL OWNER
Reviews.Author: Sam Bradford
Reviews.Content: For $288, it is an excellent deal. However, I actually have this TV. The sound sucks... It vibrates and I would recommend getting separate sound system.I also would not use it to watch sports. Drama or news are fine. But any action or motion pictures look blurry. Otherwise, it works and I haven't had any problem with it functionally. It looks and feels cheap, but it's because it IS cheap.Don't listen to all of the fake negative reviews here. It is a decent TV. I think the retail price should be at least $350 or so.

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Author: julie davisson
Reviews.Content: theses aren't bad for the price. picture is clear..was easy to mount on wall. i didn't have to mount them so of coarse it was easy!

Reviews.Title: arrived broken
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: The TV worked fine but the construction of the base is really cheap. It arrived broken and I had to return it right away. The neck of the base is flimsy and barely holds up the TV. If wall mounting it, you'll be fine. Don't rely on the base as a long term solution.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Deal
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a week or so and it works great. The picture is sharp and the color is good. It has everything my brand name TV that I paid a lot more for has. It was delivered in two days. No one would know its not a brand name TV. I think this is an incredible bargain.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, poorly designed but it works (except the shipping part)
Reviews.Author: Darryl Webber
Reviews.Content: I got the Goldbox deal on this one. The TV is bright and typically looks a bit washed out without adjusting the color, on a per device or per channel (over air) basis. All off the connections are on the side. Unfortunately, as is typical, the connections are too close to one another, making it difficult to change connections. Worse is the fact that the HDMI connections are too close to the case, so that the connector has to be forced in, slightly deflecting the case. The remote is flimsy with mediocre buttons and layout. For less than $300 it is an ok TV. Three stars for the TV.Shipping was a pain. Amazon had me schedule a delivery appointment for Friday afternoon (two days after my Prime would have had it too me via normal carriers). Friday rolled around and a trucking company (not the one that Amazon shipped with) called to make an appointment for the next Tuesday. I had already arranged to have someone take time off from work to be home Friday afternoon. The guy on the phone was rude and I thought about refusing the shipment. Instead, I lined up another person to hang out at my house to receive the shipment and called the shipping company back to set it up (very pleasant person on that call, who indicated that Amazon has no way to setup freight appointments). Monday I got a text from Amazon indicating that my TV was delivered (?). My guess is that "Pilot" handed the TV off to the other freight company on Monday. The TV was delivered on Tuesday without incident and Amazon customer service made things right.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Lightening Deal - Cable Remote Question
Reviews.Author: Diane Tumulty "mamatums"
Reviews.Content: I was one of the lucky ones who bought this at the $288 lightening deal.  It was a fun Thanksgiving Event to purchase it! I love the TV.  A 50 inch TV for that price is not something I would turn down!My question is about programming my cable remote.  None of the 3 digit codes that optimum offered me worked, so I'm stuck with using the TV remote to power it on and for volume control.  I've been searching online and even called Optimum (they were very nice, but couldn't find a code that worked).  Has anyone had success with this?  I'd appreciate the information.Thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: Paid to much for inferior picture quality. Was misled by comments.
Reviews.Author: MET100
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is poor, I would have sent it back, but the shipping cost was too high. All the distance shots are blurred. Picture not HD quality. Comments posted prier to purchase were misleading, for one, they claimed that I would be contacted prior to delivery, never happened. I was led to believe that an agent would unpack and remove packaging, never happened. FedEx just showed up and refused to cross the threshold. I would have paid a little more for a better picture. Very dissatisfied!

Reviews.Title: Ya get what ya pay for!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jaimie Prisco
Reviews.Content: Bad picture, not clear at all, cant fix it in the settings because its so limitied, In whole spend an extra few hundreds and stick with brand names that are truly better. I will never buy this brand again...

Reviews.Title: Great for the price (lightening deal)
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: This tv was excellent for the price. First HDTV i've owned so i'm not sure how great it is compared to other models but I got mine today and hooked up my ps3 and computer up to it and everything looks great. Also all the complaints about the audio had me worried that i'd have to get a soundbar or some kind of speaker setup. While the audio isn't great I wouldn't say it was bad. Definitely is enough for me and instead of spending another 100 bucks on such a deal I can save my money and perhaps spend it on something else.

Reviews.Title: Returned item!!
Reviews.Author: Demetrice Tyler
Reviews.Content: I kinda knew this price was too good for a 50-inch TV but I just HAD to purchase it anyway. Well, once I open box and its items that come with it, put together, plugged it into the wall and what do I see??? A very obvious internal damage within the TV screen. Now, Im not sure it this damage was caused by the FedEx guys or from the warehouse but I wasnt looking forward to having to pack all this stuff back into its box, esp when I came home from work to get this TV working just in time to watch my NBA ball game!! Was too disappointed. Its being returned, will see how other one looks. Will keep ya posted!!

Reviews.Title: Hiteker tv (used)
Reviews.Author: a sekesan
Reviews.Content: The pixels on the television were messed up.  The Hiteker TV was a used product, but I expected to have a clear and watchable television.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV. PICTURE SUX
Reviews.Author: MissKiiim
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv used. Seller has been awesome! I am returning it though. The picture is blurry and the pixels are an inch wide. The most blurry picture. I had a plasma that had a way better picture than this. Do not buy this tv used. The contrast ratio 4000:1 is just that. TERRIBLE. The higher the number, the better the picture.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable TV for price, but horrid remote
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: ***Update 11-28-12***Received the TV yesterday. I hadn't realized Amazon provided 'white glove' delivery (unboxing, setup / confirm operation / remove & dispose packaging).  That's a SUBSTANTIAL added value Amazon provides, evidently standard on TV purchases 48" and up sold/shipped by them (ask around - a lot of companies will charge $100+ just for that)!The TV won't win any beauty pageants for its construction aesthetics, but as much as that would be nice, I bought it for the display.  As such, it is actually quite good.  The resolution of one 1080p set is the same as another, so differences will be discernable only in matters of color accuracy, brightness, black level, contrast, angle of viewing, etc.  As it stood on it's own in my home, I was quite pleased with all of these (though black level might have been a bit truer).  Of course, it's very easy to see differences in TV's in a store side-by-side, but the truth is, you generally won't appreciate the difference much when it's on its own.  That isn't to say one set won't have a better image, but the fact remains that you really can't find a *bad* looking HDTV.The sound is, as others have mentioned, far from extraordinary.  It is however audible and clear enough - just don't expect to feel like you're aurally in the image.  For film or sports (anything you want to generate some excitement), get a soundbar or hook it up to your stereo, as you should with any TV regardless.The set doesn't have a myriad variety of connections, but what it has will suffice for most systems.  I actually tried connecting my PC to it via HDMI, and found that it worked surprisingly well.  The HDMI connections are side-mounted, and set fairly close to the back of the TV.  The cables I used fit, but just barely, so if you have a 'beefy' connector you might have an issue.  Of course, investing in 'uber high-end' HDMI cables is pointless as over HDMI you either get the unaltered signal or you don't (you're not going to get 'noise' in the line), but that's a topic for another discussion.The on-screen GUI is nothing to swoon over but it does get the job done.The remote is the only aspect of this TV that is truly 'cheap' in feel and construction.  I honestly think that within a month of moderate use some of the buttons will simply fall off. That, and the included AAA batteries were dead.  Fortunately, this remote is easily replaceable with any programmable or all-in-one remote.I'm going to continue to afford it a 5-star rating for now despite the remote, which when weighed against the Black Friday pricing it easily deserves.  Against normal pricing, it would probably still warrant 4-stars (as of now) if it weren't for the remote.  But when you get above the ridiculously cheap pricing range, a decent remote is really mandatory.----------------------------------------------------***ORIGINAL COMMENTS (11-22-12)***As to the picture, I won't waste your time detailing how and I'm more concerned with  So I'm putting this review in with preliminary thoughts now and as a placeholder for further detail upon my receipt and evaluation.First, a caveat:  Reviews that are not tagged "Amazon Verified Purchase" should be taken with about a seriously large tablespoon of salt as, especially at this time, there is a lot of 'sour grapes' commentary.  This isn't to say that they can't be accurate, but it's a pretty safe bet that given there were NO reviews posted prior the lightning deal, it seems pretty suspect that an owner would suddenly feel the need to post something about it in the first couple of hours after the sale (of a product they've allegedly had for some time) was conducted. Product reviews should be just that: product reviews.  Not a review of the sales process/experience, or availability.  For now I have given this product 5 stars as, with no other information, it is a tremendous value for the price at which I purchased it.  I expect I may end up lowering my evaluation upon receipt (scheduled for this coming Tuesday) based on construction, available connections, true contrast, color accuracy, remote, manual, ease of setup, menu operation, panel quality (any bad pixels), viewing angle, etc - though I hope it warrants maintaining a good rating.At 50" and full HD (1080P), this is most likely an amazing deal at the lightning deal price. Since that deal is done, anyone considering this set should wait for more information before investing the 'normal' price.As an aside, to those commenting on the listed contrast ratio, it warrants noting that there is no industry standard or regulated procedure for determining a display's contrast ratio, i.e. it is pretty much a worthless stat (i.e., a TV with 4,000:1 might actually provide greater contrast than one with a 20,000:1 ratio, or worse contrast than one with a 2,000:1 ratio).More details to come next week...---------------------Edit to provide more technical details about this model as garnered from another website:*  50" LCD panel with a 1920 x 1080 Full HD resolution*  True 16:9 aspect ratio*  View your movies as the director intended on the 1080p 60Hz LCD HDTV*  Wide 176-degree vertical and 176-degree horizontal angles*  See a clear picture from anywhere in the room*  The flat screen LCD TV features a built-in digital tuner*  Watch digital broadcasts, including HDTV programs where available*  High brightness of 350 cd/m2 and 8.5 ms response time*  Quick response time for a great picture*  40,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio*  HDMI Inputs: 3*  Enjoy a superior HD experience with HDMI one cable solution*  50" screen measured diagonally from corner to corner*  ENERGY STAR®Brightness:  350cd/m2Contrast Ratio:  40,000:1Remote Included: YesResolution:  1080p (HDTV)Response Time:  8.5 msTv Definition:  HDTVTv Technology:  LCDPrimary Color:  BlackModel No.: TL50Z10AH-TPShipping Weight (in pounds):  75.0Shipping Dimensions:  46.0 x 11.0 x 31.4

Reviews.Title: Happy Thanksgiving!
Reviews.Author: gabriel
Reviews.Content: This TV has an average of fours stars on Walmart. Ignore all those negative reviews. They are just upset that they missed it. This TV ROCKS!!!!"You snooze, you lose"

Reviews.Title: Excellent Deal!
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Good TV for a great price. Negative reviews come from potential buyers that did not get in on this deal. Don't listen to them!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: happygirl
Reviews.Content: I have a 32-inch one in bedroom, the picture is clear, the color is great without adjustment, and the sound excellent for the bedroom. Nice TV.

Reviews.Title: Worth it
Reviews.Author: I. Haider
Reviews.Content: Completely worth it especially for this great price. don't listen to these people with negative reviews who weren't able to get the deal

Reviews.Title: this is a review
Reviews.Author: technykal
Reviews.Content: No name brand = cheap overpriced chinese mass produced garbage quality tv, therefore you should not buy it.It's also strange that they are advertising the tv with 30 Day Free Technical support, as if they know that something will go wrong!60Hz is pretty crappy, and BF deals should get from here!but for everyone that got on the BF waitlist superfast -- good job, you're living by the motto BUY FIRST, THINK LATER!
